intro: Epipactis atrorubens var. dilatata, commonly known as the purple marsh helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to wetland habitats in North America. It features a basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and produces tall, erect stems with showy, violet to purple flowers. The flowers have a distinctive lip that is often darker and more intricately patterned than the rest of the flower. It is a perennial plant that thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and swamps. The species is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance as a pollinator attractant.
